Package il.ac.hit.Interfaces

Interface ICalcGPA

All Known Implementing Classes:
Calculations
public interface ICalcGPA
This interface is intended to make it easier for us to get an object that his solely purpose is to calculate the grades for us from inside the DB
See Also:
the class that implements this interface

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.Double calculate_GPA()
    calculate_GPA function calculates and returns the GPA based on the grades within the database
    java.lang.Double gpaByGrade​(java.lang.String courseName, java.lang.Integer newGrade)
    gpaByGrade function calculates and returns the new GPA based on the grades within the database, while replacing the new grade in the calculated GPA

  • Method Details

    • calculate_GPA

      java.lang.Double calculate_GPA() throws DBActionsException
      calculate_GPA function calculates and returns the GPA based on the grades within the database

      The function reaches to the database from within the Model package, pulls all the courses grades and calculates the GPA based on a formula.

      Returns:
      the calculated GPA
      Throws:
      DBActionsException - in case of an SQL error
      See Also:
      The function used for this interface in this project

    • gpaByGrade

      java.lang.Double gpaByGrade​(java.lang.String courseName, java.lang.Integer newGrade) throws DBActionsException
      gpaByGrade function calculates and returns the new GPA based on the grades within the database, while replacing the new grade in the calculated GPA

      The function reaches to the database from within the Model package, pulls all the courses grades, replacing the relevant course with the desired grade and calculates the GPA based on a formula.

      Parameters:
      courseName - the desired course that his grade going to be replaced with
      newGrade - the new grade that will go to the GPA formula instead the current one
      Returns:
      the calculated GPA
      Throws:
      DBActionsException - in case of an SQL error
      See Also:
      The function used for this interface in this project
